full_threads.body:
Hi Alejandro,

Thanks for the update - all looks good on our end. The GTM setup is firing the correct parent SKUs exactly as needed.

Those unmatched ID warnings and match rate below 90% are completely normal right now. They reflect historical “bad” data, and it usually takes about 7 days of clean events for Commerce Manager to catch up.

To double-check before scaling:
  1. Go to Events Manager → Test Events.
  2. Open a Char-Griller product page in a new window.
  3. You should see a ViewContent event appear with the correct Content ID/Match Quality.

If that test looks clean, everything is ready to go - you can ignore the dashboard warnings for now. They’ll resolve themselves automatically.

Happy to verify the Test Events directly from our side if you want to grant us access to the Meta Business Manager.

Hi Adriane,
Just wanted to share a quick update and ask for a double-check from your side.
It's been around 72 hours since the GTM switch, and in Commerce Manager we're now seeing:

There are still warnings around unmatched content IDs and a match rate below 90%. I understand these can relate to historical data, but I just wanted to confirm with you that everything on the GTM side is firing as expected and that there's nothing else we should adjust at this stage.
Just keen to make sure we're fully set before scaling catalogue ads.
Thanks again for your help.

Alejandro Bassi

​​​​

Social Media Manager





abassi@mayohardware.com.au



www.mayohardware.com.au



+61 417 147 664



Customer Service: 1300 360 211

Thanks so much for the update Adriane, really appreciate the quick turnaround.
I'll keep an eye on the match rate in Commerce Manager over the next 24-48 hours and let you know if anything else comes up.
Thanks again for your help!
Kind regards,

Alejandro Bassi

​​​​

Social Media Manager





abassi@mayohardware.com.au

Hi Alejandro,

Thanks for the update - and appreciate your patience.

We’ve now completed the switch to Google Tag Manager so product events send the correct SKUs moving forward.

Quick summary:
1. Disabled Incorrect Tracking
  • Turned off event tracking in Facebook for WooCommerce.
  • Catalogue sync stays active, but the plugin no longer sends variation-based IDs.
2. GTM Setup (Now Live)
  • Created and installed a new GTM container for Char-Griller.
  • Added GTM4WP and enabled “Use SKU instead of ID” to ensure clean parent SKUs.
3. Pixel Rebuild
  • Meta Pixel reinstalled via GTM.
  • New ViewContent tag now sends the correct SKU to Meta.

You should see the match rate in Commerce Manager improve over the next 24–48 hours as Meta processes the new data.

If anything else pops up, just let us know - happy to help.

Hi Adriane, Thanks again for your help. I've completed the reconnection steps in WordPress and confirmed that the Facebook for WooCommerce plugin is now fully connected - the catalogue is syncing correctly, and the Facebook/Instagram Shops are active. However, after testing the pixel in Events Manager, I can see that the product-level events are still sending incorrect content IDs. For example, the ViewContent event is passing values like: content_ids: ["CG3070_6814"] instead of the correct product ID/SKU: ["CG3070"] Because of this mismatch, Meta can't match product views or purchases to the catalogue. This explains the 0% product views, the low match rate in Commerce Manager, and the warnings about unmatched content IDs. It looks like the plugin is passing WooCommerce variation IDs rather than the actual product SKU, which lines up with the behaviour you mentioned. Based on your recommendation, I agree that the best approach is to proceed with Plan B:
  • Disable event tracking in the Facebook for WooCommerce plugin (but keep catalogue sync active)
  • Use Google Tag Manager to manually send clean ViewContent, AddToCart, and Purchase events with the correct product IDs. Does Char-Griller already have a GTM container?
Please let me know the next steps from your side. Thanks again for your support. Alejandro Bassi ​​​​ Social Media Manager abassi@mayohardware.com.au www.mayohardware.com.au +61 417 147 664 Customer Service: 1300 360 211 CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: This e-mail message, including any attachments, is for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain confidential and privileged information or otherwise be protected by law. Any unauthorised review, use, disclosure or distribution is prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender by reply e-mail and destroy all copies of the original message.

Hi Bonnie,

Thanks so much for reaching out to Wolf IQ Support - happy to help!

Here are my findings after checking the backend:
1. Plugin Cleanup
  • I noticed the site had two Facebook pixel plugins active. This can cause duplicate or conflicting events.
  • I’ve gone ahead and deactivated the extra “Meta Pixel for WordPress” plugin.
  • The site is now using only “Facebook for WooCommerce,” which is the correct one for catalogue syncing.
2. What’s Working & What’s Not
  • The Meta pixel is connected and tracking general activity.
  • However, it’s currently not sending product-specific data (e.g., which grill someone viewed).
  • This missing product info is what’s causing the Catalogue ads to fail on Meta’s side.
3. Quick Fix Needed on Your Side (Reconnect to Meta Business Manager)
Because the plugin is tied to your Business Manager, you’re the only one who can fully refresh the connection.
When you have a moment, can you please:
  • Log in to WordPress
  • Go to Marketing → Facebook
  • Open the Settings tab
  • Click Disconnect
  • After the page reloads, click Connect to re-authorize the Business Manager
This usually “wakes up” the product events and fixes the data issue.

4. Plan B (If the Reset Doesn’t Work)
If the reconnect doesn’t fix things - totally okay, this plugin is known to be temperamental - we have a reliable workaround:
  • Disable the plugin’s tracking feature (but keep catalogue syncing active)
  • Use Google Tag Manager to manually send the correct product IDs and events to Meta
  • This gives us cleaner, more consistent tracking for ViewContent, AddToCart, and Purchase

Happy to keep supporting until everything is running smoothly! Wolf IQ Support is always happy to help

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Adriane Roa

full_threads.body:
Hi Team,

We are trying to implement a Pixel for Char-Griller so we can use it to launch a catalogue ad campaign.

We are having some issues and can't quite work out what's going wrong. Can you please assist us with this? Please let me know what information you require. The Meta pixel has already been set up however it looks like it's failing on the Meta side.

Thanks








Bonnie Sudirwan
